title: Yes, you might want to read this question twice
content:
Right, I recently started with Flash, so my knowledge of it leaves much to be desired.   
   
because regular anti-aliased fonts don't give the right feel to the design, I turned my head towards pixelfonts, but also those I found far from being my choice.   
   
The only solution that I found satisfying was using html text Verdana.   
   
[insert laughter and possible insults]   
   
right, is there a pixelfont which comes incredibly close to the html/anti aliased version of Verdana at font size="2" ?   
   
Thanks for your patience ![:)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019111416im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
author: anonymous

comments.content:
\> is there a pixelfont which comes incredibly   
\> close to the html/anti aliased version of   
\> Verdana at font size="2" ?   
   
I wish there were. It would help the HTML and   
Flash elements of a site/page integrate better.
Okay, so how then to integrate the html aliased Verdana font in an all flashsite?

Selecting the textfield options use device fonts and selectable should do the trick.   
   
but there are other ways as well.
